raw_comment: I noticed that in the legacy area, someone who has a generation and history of people going to a specific league school has a higher chance of getting accepted than someone who does not have any legacies. Also, people in the upper class have a higher chance of being accepted and going to an Ivy League rather than those in the middle and lower class which is not out of the ordinary. This brings attention to the fact that just because someone is wealthier doesn't necessarily mean they are more advanced in education and talents.
ace_sentences: Legacy admissions exist in Ivy League schools.
A legacy applicant is a person whose family has a history of attending a specific Ivy League school.
A legacy applicant has a higher chance of acceptance than a non-legacy applicant.
An upper-class person has a higher chance of acceptance to an Ivy League school than a middle-class person.
An upper-class person has a higher chance of acceptance to an Ivy League school than a lower-class person.
A wealthier person is not necessarily more advanced in education than a less wealthy person.
A wealthier person is not necessarily more talented than a less wealthy person.
